text: While sitting on the couch watch TV, March 2, 2024, I felt a terrible pain in my left lower back.  The pain intensified in just a few short minuets.  I was on my knees in pain about to vomit, face sweating, and could not find relieve in any position.  After 4 hours of this, I started looking through the medicine cabinet for anything that would relieve the pain so I could get some sleep.  As I could only find ibuprofen, I took two, which seemed to help, Saturday mooring I felt great!  I was even able to get a P90X work-out in, before going shopping with my wife.  Halfway through shopping, my symptoms returned.  I couldn't wait to get back home and take something for the pain.  I remember feeling every bump in the road as it shot pain up my back.  Again, several ibuprofens and 45 minutes later the pain was gone!  I went to my family doctor on Monday, based on a urine sample, she said it looks like a kidney stone.  As this was my first, I had no idea what I was dealing with.  An X-Ray and Cat-scan that day confirmed a 7,5mm stone was stuck in my ureter.  As this was said to be too large to pass, she advised me to contact the Urology Group in Cincinnati, and she put me on Flowmax.  Researching this on the internet, I started drinking lots of water with lemon juice and apple cider vinger each day.  Although still no pain, on March 13, the Urology Group performed an Extracorporeal shockwave  Lithotripsy to break up the stone.  Although they said the procedure was successful, breaking the stone into two pieces, a day later only some gravel and a bee-bee size piece were expelled.  Although still no pain, two weeks later a follow-up X-ray revealed the stone was still 6,5mm and still stuck in my ureter.  Therefore, aside from pain of the procedure and a cost of $10,000, the Lithotripsy did very little, and the Urology Group then prescribed a more invasive procedure of using a laser to go inside and break it up.  Not looking forward to another procedure and encouraged by the many successful reviews, I ordered this product.  In addition to the Flowmax and drinking 2.5 liters of water per day with concentrated lemon juice, I have been taking it as prescribed for two weeks now, with no results whatsoever!  I was discouraged to hear that this company recently changed their ingredients and the reviews since then have been far less successful.  Unless the pain returns, I believe I will try to wait this out to see if it will eventually pass.  I will repost as this progresses, and hopefully share with all a success story, but for now, this product doesn't seem to help at all!
